children.text: The brickwork is overhanging the edge of the slab by more than the allowable amount.
Part 3.2.2.7 Edge Rebates of the NCC’s Building Code of Australia (BCA) requires that
‘Exterior masonry must not overhang more that 15mm past the edge of the slab’.
Additionally, the Victorian Building Authority’s Guide to Standards & Tolerances in clause 3.16 Masonry that overhangs concrete slabs states that
‘A masonry course is defective if it is laid on a concrete slab or strip footing so as to project over the edge of the slab or footing by more than 15 mm’.

This section of brickwork is clearly over this allowance, so the slab will need to be extended using an appropriately designed and certified engineered system. The owner should request a copy of the documentation from the engineer to confirm the engineer is aware of this issue.
